title: cli configuration
description: Defines configuration to be used with cli

url.description: Initial URL to start recording from

workdir.description: Directory where logs (eg: jtl files) and other relevant data is stored

urlIncludes.description:
Regular expressions used to only record requests with matching URLs.
NOTE: Don't include scheme (e.g: http://) in regex

urlExcludes.description:
Regular expressions used to NOT record requests with matching URLs.
NOTE: Don't include scheme (e.g: http://) in regex

urlIgnoreDefaultFilter.description: Specifies to use or not the default URL filter. The default filter ignores URLs matching: (?i).*\.(bmp|css|js|gif|ico|jpe?g|png|svg|swf|ttf|woff2?|webp)(\?.*)?

logFilteredRequests.description: Specifies to include in generated JTL file, filtered and not recorded requests or not.

headerExcludes.description: Regular expressions used to ignore matching headers from recording

headerIgnoreDefaultFilter.description: Specifies to use or not the default headers filter. The default filter ignores these headers: Accept-Language,Upgrade-Insecure-Requests,Accept-Encoding,User-Agent,Accept,Referer,Origin,X-Requested-With,Cache-Control

correlations.description: Specifies list of correlation rules between requests and previous responses, avoiding fixed and brittle recorded test plans

variable.description: Name of the variable used to store a value extracted from a response and to be used in a following request

extractor.description: Defines regular expression and, optionally, other parameters which define how to extract values from responses (or even requests), to be used in following requests

oneOf.description: Regular expression where the first capturing group defines the extracted value, while the rest is used for context matching

regex.description: Regular expression where the first capturing group defines the extracted value, while the rest is used for context matching

target.description:
Specifies sample result property to apply the extractor to.
For details on available options check: https://javadoc.io/static/us.abstracta.jmeter/jmeter-java-dsl/1.8/us/abstracta/jmeter/javadsl/core/postprocessors/DslRegexExtractor.TargetField.html#enum.constant.summary

replacement.description: Regular expression used to replace in requests previously extracted values. The first capturing group defines the place where the extracted value should appear (and replaced by variable reference), while the rest of the regex is used for context matching
